name: The Wall Street Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved staying at The Wall st inn! Such a beautiful victorian style hotel and great value for good sized rooms especially for NY standards! Loved the fact that outside there was a whole laneway full of pubs and restaurants outside the hotel. The hotel is located right down in the Financial District and about a 10 min walk to Battery Park. So easy to get around by subway and taxis are everywhere! Extremely safe area to walk around late at night. Breakfast was ok just wished there was more variety of healthy options, more fresh fruit or yogurt instead of sugar glazed pastries and bagels. Also found some of the reception staff a bit sour but didnt let it ruin our stay. All housekeeping staff were extremely nice! I think the majority of guests are usually people on business obviously being in the financial district. We would definitely stay here again regardless!
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great bed, very comfortable and the room had a lot of character. Great part of town close to the subway but away from the loud hustle and bustle of upper Manhattan. The temperature was fine as of 7/24/10, and we had no problems with humidity like other guests were saying. There was a free breakfast which included the usual cereal and bagels, but also very yummy pastries and hard boiled eggs, coffee, juice, etc.
reviews.title: Great night sleep in comfy bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only reasons I'm not going 5 stars is because the free wireless was very weak, and only worked when we put the laptop in a certain position at the edge of the bed, and also the water pressure in the faucet was so weak that I had to wash my hands in the bathtub! (I'm guessing there might be restrictions on water in NYC in July, or they might have needed to tweak some plumbing. I didn't ask, and if I did they might have fixed it, but we were only there 2 nights so it wasn't a huge deal.)
reviews.title: Love this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights, during a short NY-visit and it was just lovely!
reviews.title: Not the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Spacious, clean room and bathroom, very good beds!
reviews.title: an oasis in NY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a day in the busy streets around time square and rockefeller center you feel happy to return to the calm envirement of wallstreet in the evening. The hotel has very good access to the metro and you will find several restaurant in the neighbourhood. We can recommend this hotel to everybody
reviews.title: money worth accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had great service. we showed up about 10:30 am and were able to check in as our room was ready for us. we really liked the receptionist who was there for the day shift, she always greeted us with a smile. she told us where to find lunch and how to find the subway. we were able to store our luggage there after we checked out until we were ready to go to the airport, then she called the car service they use.
reviews.title: a cozy place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010
reviews.text: the cleaner always said hi when she saw us in the hall.
reviews.title: Great place, very recommendable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: they should upgrade their double beds to queens, i had a good sleep but my feet were hanging off the end of the bed. it was a nice cozy room. the bathroom was nice and had a nice big tub.
reviews.title: Great base for New York explorers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the breakfast offered was hard boiled eggs, cereal, toast, bagels and pastries. there was also a wide assortment of teas, coffee, orange juice, milk and water.
reviews.title: Don't stay here if you want to sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 505 for one night. We usually stay on Upper West Side, but picked this hotel because it was well priced and well reviewed on Trip Advisor. Room was large for NYC. Staff was helpful and helped us arrange transport to JFK early am for $40 (a good deal for JFK). There was a small continental breakfast in the morning. Hotel was quiet and well maintained. The neighborhood is quiet and close to shopping at Century 21, the World Trade Center site and Wall Street.
reviews.title: great value, good rooms, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I needed a room for only one night. We had a concert to attend in the West Village and knew we'd be out very late and didn't want to drag ourselves back to New Jersey at 2:00 in the morning.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I work down the block from the Wall Street and and pass it daily. Since I know the neighborhood so well I realized it would be very quiet in the morning, something which was going be important to us since we'd be getting in so late.
reviews.title: Very clean and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I called the hotel directly and when I mentioned I work in the neighborhood they reduced the rate of the room and gave me a King for a Queen rate. I checked in during my lunch hour (barely a 5 minute walk if that). I was given a room on the 5th floor, however, it was directly across from the elevator which I anticipated as being problematic in the morning with it dinging as people would depart and enter it while we were trying to sleep.
reviews.title: Quite good but could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went back downstairs and presented the problem. The woman at the front desk was very nice and understood. She had another room, a corner king which she graciously gave me at the same rate. It wasn't quite ready so I went to grab some lunch and came back 1/2 hour later.
reviews.title: Visit this hotel for authentic NY experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: In NY to attend a weekend workshop, I came across an airfare and hotel deal that couldn't be beat financially. And the hotel - the Wall Street Inn - exceeded my expectations. Great bed (firm mattress - in a good way), relatively spacious room, 2 chairs and a small table, well designed bathroom, decent continental breakfast. Room, even though it overlooked a small portion of the Stone Street restaurants (with outdoor seating), was pretty darn quiet - and this is from a light sleeper. A/C worked well though not exactly quiet.
reviews.title: Perfect Weekend Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Less than a five minute walk to several subway lines, including the J line at Broad Street which is a direct line to JFK's AIrLink system (note that Broad Street Station is closed on weekends; the A Train to Fulton is probably the better bet on weekends). Always seems to be some activity in the area, even on weekend evenings, so it felt safe at all times.
reviews.title: Aside from the Room Humidity, a Perfect Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Close to Staten Island Ferry, and about 10 minutes by the 4 or 5 Express trains to Grand Central. They also have a computer and printer so you can print your airline boarding passes.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: My best friend and I stayed for three nights in a room with two double beds. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Everything in the hotel is in such great shape that it looks brand new. Our room was just the right size and exceptionally clean. Other than a small amount of evening noise coming from the outdoor seating for the restaurants around the block and one day when they constructed scaffolding around the building next door, it was extremely quiet. The beds were comfortable and the linens soft. We really appreciated having the mini-fridge in the room. The continental breakfast was fresh and had a great selection of items. This hotel was an incredible value and I hope to return!
reviews.title: Gorgeous Oasis, Home away from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing keeping me from giving this hotel a perfect rating is the fact that it was extremely humid in our room. It was apparent that the hotel was aware of the issue (and that we weren't the only ones experiencing it) because there was one dehumidifier in the hall the first night, and a second one added for the second and third nights, but they weren't doing much to help out the situation on the other side of our door. We felt a small improvement the third night, but it was still apparent. I'm not sure if this was a temporary problem or not - I wish I would have asked, but we left in a hurry and I forgot to.
reviews.title: a lovely oasis amidst the hustle and bustle of Wall Street

aka: Wall Street Hotel New York City
description: Wall Street Inn welcomes you to a perfect downtown location near the New York Stock Exchange and all lower Manhattan corporations. Our intimate hotel brings charm to the traveler and offers comfort at an affordable price. It is ideal for your next business or vacation trip to New York.
